intro: Kanahia forskalii, commonly known as the Hawaiian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has oval-shaped leaves and produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Kanahia forskalii plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators.
